title: 'Carbon-negative' Celo to 'return home' to Ethereum as layer-2 - Blockworks
summary: Celo, a carbon-negative blockchain, is planning to transition from its current independent chain to a layer-2 network on Ethereum using the Optimism stack. The move aims to align Celo more closely with Ethereum and leverage its economic security. The transition will occur as a hard fork and will not affect end users or existing dApps, including those in the regenerative finance stack. The move is expected to help Celo grow and reduce network storage expenses.

title: Celo Proposes to Ditch Own Standalone Blockchain for Layer-2 Network on Ethereum - CoinDesk
summary: Celo, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, is proposing to shift from its standalone blockchain to a layer-2 network on Ethereum. This change could simplify liquidity sharing, boost security, and provide a seamless developer experience. Celo is already compatible with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), making it easy for Ethereum developers to port their existing apps or create new ones using similar tools.

title: Ethereum Price Prepares For The Next Move As Risk of Bounce Grows - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is consolidating losses near $1,900 after failing to break above $2,000. The cryptocurrency is at risk of a bounce, but a move above $1,930 is needed to trigger a fresh rally. Support levels are at $1,920, $1,900, and $1,850, while resistance levels are at $1,950, $2,000, and $2,120. Technical indicators, such as MACD and RSI, are losing momentum in the bearish zone.

title: Proto-Danksharding Is Going to Change Ethereum Completely—And for The Better - Bitrates
summary: Proto-danksharding is coming to Ethereum in Q4 2023, which will allow rollups to add cheaper data to blocks and reduce network fees. This is the first step towards danksharding, which involves splitting the blockchain into smaller, more efficient chains. The upgrade will use blobs to store data, which can be retrieved efficiently and will help alleviate the network burden. The Dencun hard fork will implement proto-danksharding, and the blobs will set the foundation for data sharding. Ethereum will use KZG commitments as its polynomial commitment scheme. The upgrade is nearing the final stages of planning, and an in-depth specs document will be released soon.

title: Ethereum Stablecoin Developer Ethena Surpasses Epic Milestone - U.Today
summary: Ethena, a crypto start-up, has raised $6 million in seed funding for its innovative stablecoin project, USDe, which utilizes Ethereum derivatives and a hedging mechanism to maintain a stable value relative to the US dollar. Unlike previous attempts, Ethena's approach uses collateral from users to hedge price exposure through shorting Ethereum via perpetual swaps, setting it apart from current stablecoin leaders USDC and USDT. The funding round was led by Dragonfly and received support from prominent investors in the cryptocurrency industry, including BitMEX founder Arthur Hayes.

title: Celo Blockchain Proposes Return to Ethereum to Become Layer 2 - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Celo blockchain, a Layer 1 chain born from Ethereum, is considering a transition to an Ethereum Layer 2 chain. cLabs, the entity behind Celo, proposes using Optimism's OP Stack and EigenLayer for off-chain data availability, while maintaining low fees and no changes to existing dApps or mobile-first features. The transition would not impact end users or CELO holders, but validators and full node operators would need to run an additional Ethereum node. The community is invited to a governance call on July 21 to discuss the proposed changes.

title: Unstoppable Domains adds .eth domains through Ethereum Name Service - Cointelegraph
summary: Unstoppable Domains has announced support for.eth domain names from the Ethereum Name Service (ENS), allowing users to buy and manage Web3 domains in one place. This integration adds.eth domains to Unstoppable's existing support for.nft,.crypto,.wallet,.dao,.bitcoin,.polygon, and.blockchain domains. Users can now purchase.eth names through Unstoppable with added payment methods and functionality, and all.eth domains purchased will be registered through the ENS smart contract. Unstoppable also offers non-custodial domain management through Unstoppable Vault, allowing users to secure Web3 domains without an initial cryptocurrency wallet. Additionally, Unstoppable is developing.eth domain management tools, including the ability to set cryptocurrency addresses and transfer domains.

title: Ethereum Scaling Solution zkSync Unveils Latest Prover Tech ‘Boojum’ - Decrypt
summary: zkSync, a scaling solution for Ethereum, has launched the latest upgrade, Boojum, to lower the hardware barrier for users to participate in securing the network. The new prover can be operated with as little as 8 GB of hardware, compared to the average prover's demand for 500 GB. This will make it more accessible to users and potentially repurpose the mining industry. The upgrade also aims to decentralize zkSync's sequencer, responsible for ordering transactions in each block, and may launch a token in the future.

title: Aave Protocol launches stablecoin GHO on Ethereum mainnet, $2M minted - Cointelegraph
summary: Aave Protocol launched its stablecoin GHO on the Ethereum mainnet, with $2.19 million worth of GHO minted so far. GHO is a decentralized, over-collateralized stablecoin backed by a multitude of digital assets, including Ethereum's native currency Ether and Aave's native token AAVE. The launch followed a community governance vote with nearly 100% approval. Unlike centralized stablecoins, GHO's assets are transparent and verifiable, and its revenue will further bolster Aave's DAO treasury. GHO is currently available to the public and can be minted using assets as collateral. The launch marks another addition to the growing ranks of DeFi-native algorithmic stablecoins, but the total stablecoin market remains dominated by centralized issuers. At current, GHO is trading slightly below the $1 peg.

title: Celo Blockchain is returning to the Ethereum ecosystem with the L2 transition - Forbes India
summary: Celo, a blockchain platform, plans to transition from an independent layer-1 blockchain to an Ethereum layer-2 (L2) solution, leveraging OP Stack as the architecture. The move aims to benefit from Ethereum's robust tooling and libraries, enhance compatibility, and expand development possibilities. The transition would involve establishing an off-chain data availability layer operated by Ethereum node operators and secured by restaked Ether (ETH). Existing validators would become decentralized sequencers for the L2 solution. The proposal is scheduled for discussion on July 21 and could mark a significant milestone in Celo's evolution and integration with the broader Ethereum network.

title: Bridging the Gap Between Solana and Ethereum: Neon EVM Debuts on Solana Mainnet - Crypto Briefing
summary: Neon EVM, an Ethereum Virtual Machine, has launched on Solana mainnet to bridge the gap between Ethereum and Solana's computing models. It enables Ethereum DApps to utilize Solana for transaction settlements with minimal code reconfiguration. Solana's average transaction fee is $0.0002, a 10,000-fold saving compared to Ethereum's $2 average fee. The launch has also activated the Neon DAO, a community that will influence the future of Neon EVM.

title: Just-In: Gnosis Unveils Visa-Certified Debit Card at Ethereum Conference - CoinGape
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Gnosis, a leading blockchain company, has unveiled Gnosis Pay and Gnosis Card, the world's first decentralized payment network and self-custodial debit card. The card is Visa-certified and will initially be available in EU and EEA countries, with expansion plans for Q4 in the US, Brazil, Mexico, Singapore, and Hong Kong. Users can spend stablecoins and Visa payments on the card, and the team is working on integrating MakerDAO's decentralized stablecoin, DAI, for further payment options. The service incurs a 30 EURe fee and marks the beginning of a new era in crypto payments.

summary:

* Ethereum faces scalability challenges due to high network congestion, limited transaction throughput, and high fees.

* Linea offers improved scalability, faster transactions, and lower fees, making it an attractive solution for developers and users.

title: What Is Gnosis? How Decentralized Prediction Markets Work - Decrypt
summary:
Gnosis is a blockchain project that started as a decentralized prediction market in 2015 and has since evolved into a broader ecosystem of products and services. The project's main components include:

1. Gnosis Chain: an Ethereum sidechain for stable transactions that leverages the xDai token.
2. CoW Protocol: a permissionless decentralized exchange (DEX) that matches buyers and sellers through multi-token batch auctions and executes trades at the most favorable available price.
3. Safe: a customizable multisignature wallet infrastructure that operates as a smart contract wallet on the Ethereum network.
4. GnosisDAO: a decentralized collective that stewards the Gnosis ecosystem through futarchy, a form of governance where prediction markets play a crucial role in determining which policies will have the most positive effect.
5. Conditional Tokens: a new asset class designed to facilitate the creation of highly liquid prediction markets.
6. Gnosis Auction: a platform that helps projects discover a fair price for their token.

title: Fantom (FTM) Founder Andre Cronje Says Multichain Hack Was a ‘Big Blow’ to Ethereum Rival’s Ecosystem - The Daily Hodl
summary: Fantom (FTM) creator Andre Cronje revealed that the recent Multichain exploit was a "big blow" to the Ethereum (ETH) rival's ecosystem. The Fantom team was misled about Multichain's security level, and they are now exploring options to make victims whole. The total value locked (TVL) in Fantom has drastically fallen, from $200 million to $67 million, and Multichain has shuttered its operations. The incident highlights the risks of investing in cryptocurrencies and the importance of thorough due diligence.

summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

This innovation strengthens Ethereum's layer-2 scaling solution and sets the stage for a scalable and cost-effective era of Ethereum layer-2 scaling.

title: Arthur Hayes's "Holy Grail" Stablecoin DeFi Project Ethena Raises $6M - Ethereum World News
summary:
Arthur Hayes's "Holy Grail" Stablecoin DeFi Project Ethena Raises $6M

Ethena, a startup developing a stablecoin and digital savings bond backed by derivatives, has secured $6 million in seed funding. The project is led by DragonFly, a venture capital firm founded by Arthur Hayes, former CEO of BitMEX. Ethena aims to create a decentralized and accessible financial system, providing individuals with a stablecoin and savings bond that can be stored and grown without relying on traditional banking infrastructure.

Ethena's stablecoin is unique in that it is backed by equal amounts of staked ETH and perpetual swaps shorting Ethereum, allowing it to maintain its peg to the US dollar without depending on traditional banking systems. The savings bond is similar to a US treasury bond but is permissionless and accessible to individuals worldwide.

The project aims to address the limitations of existing stablecoins, which are often susceptible to manipulation and volatility. Ethena's approach leverages the decentralization and transparency

title: Unstoppable Domains expands Web3 offerings with Ethereum Name Service support - Cryptopolitan
summary: Unstoppable Domains, a digital identity platform, has expanded its Web3 offerings by supporting Ethereum Name Service (ENS) domain names. This integration allows users to register simpler names like "me.eth" instead of lengthy wallet addresses. Unstoppable now offers.eth,.nft, and.polygon domain endings and has introduced features to streamline domain ownership and management, including auto-renewal and a vault for custody buyers' domains. The platform also supports both fiat payments and cryptocurrencies. Unstoppable is working on developing.eth domain management tools and is actively participating in the Web3 Domain Alliance to foster collaboration and standardization in the Web3 space.

title: zkSync unveils Boojum upgrade to enhance Ethereum Layer-2 scaling - Cryptopolitan
summary: Matter Labs, the developer of zkSync, has announced the launch of Boojum, a new proof system that will enhance the performance and accessibility of zkSync Era. Boojum is built on a new Rust-based cryptographic library and utilizes STARK technology to power zero-knowledge (ZK) circuits, promising several times more throughput than previous reliance on SNARKs. The upgrade will transition zkSync Era to a STARK-powered proof system, providing world-class performance on consumer-grade hardware, with reduced hardware requirements and improved performance. This will boost zkSync Era and the broader Ethereum ecosystem, enabling a wider range of users to engage with the network and contribute to its growth. The innovation presented by Matter Labs and zkSync holds the potential to shape the future of Layer 2 scaling solutions and has implications for decentralized finance (DeFi) applications and broader blockchain adoption.

title: What Is Ethereum Rainbow Chart & How to Predict ETH Price? - Captain Altcoin
summary:
The Ethereum Rainbow Chart is a graphical representation of ETH’s price movements that uses color bands to indicate whether ETH is overvalued or overvalued at any given time. The chart is based on logarithmic regression and features a color-coded spectrum to represent different price zones. The chart can be used to analyze historical and potential future ETH price movements and make informed investment decisions.

The chart features nine distinct bands, each representing a particular price level in historical context. If ETH is trading in the red band, it means that it is heavily overbought and could see a price correction. Conversely, if ETH is trading in the blue band, it means that it is very low compared to its historical trend and could be a good time to buy.

The Ethereum Rainbow Chart can be a useful tool for investors and Ethereum holders looking to make informed investment decisions. However, it should not be used as a foolproof prediction tool due to its limitations. It is best used as a complementary research tool in combination with other analytical resources.
